raw: * Objects which are used as delegates for the qx.ui.tree.VirtualTree may
* implement any of the methods described in this interface. The delegate does
* not need to implement all the methods of this interface. If a method is not
* implemented the qx.ui.tree.VirtualTree provides a default
* implementation.
* Note: This interface is meant to document the delegate but should not be
* listed in the implement key of a class unless all methods are
* actually implemented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Objects which are used as delegates for the qx.ui.tree.VirtualTree may implement any of the methods described in this interface. The delegate does not need to implement all the methods of this interface. If a method is not implemented the qx.ui.tree.VirtualTree provides a default implementation. Note: This interface is meant to document the delegate but should not be listed in the implement key of a class unless all methods are actually implemented.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to set individual styles and properties
* on the widget cells created by the controller.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} Item to modify.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to set individual styles and properties on the widget cells created by the controller.

raw: * Creates a widget cell which will be used for rendering. Be sure to
* implement the {@link #bindItem} function as well to get the needed
* properties bound.
* @return {qx.ui.core.Widget} A new created item cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates a widget cell which will be used for rendering. Be sure to implement the {@link #bindItem} function as well to get the needed properties bound.

raw: * Sets up the binding for the given widget cell and index.
* For every property you want to bind, use
* {@link MWidgetController#bindProperty} like this:
* <code>
* controller.bindProperty(null, "value", options, item, id);
*
* @param controller {qx.ui.list.core.MWidgetController} The currently used controller.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The created and used item.
* @param id {Integer} The id for the binding.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets up the binding for the given widget cell and index. For every property you want to bind, use {@link MWidgetController#bindProperty} like this: controller.bindProperty(null, "value", options, item, id);

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.ui.core.Widget} The created and used item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {Integer} The id for the binding.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to reset properties or states.
* @param item {qx.ui.core.Widget} Item to modify.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to reset properties or states.

raw: * Filter checks the current data and returns a boolean if the data should
* appear in the filtered data set or not.
* @param data {var} The data which will be checked.
* @return {Boolean} True, if the data passes the filter, false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Filter checks the current data and returns a boolean if the data should appear in the filtered data set or not.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} The data which will be checked.
@param.description: The data which will be checked.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} True, if the data passes the filter, false otherwise.
@return.description: True, if the data passes the filter, false otherwise.

raw: * Gives the user the opportunity to sort the children items from a node.
* The sorting method should return a negative value if a < b, zero
* if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.
* @param a {var} value to compare.
* @param b {var} value to compare.
* @return {Integer} should return a negative value if a < b, zero
*   if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gives the user the opportunity to sort the children items from a node. The sorting method should return a negative value if a < b, zero if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer} should return a negative value if a < b, zero
   if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.
@return.description:
should return a negative value if a < b, zero
   if a = b, or a positive value if a > b.
